verbs.description: ungive (third-person singular simple present ungives, present participle ungiving, simple past ungave, past participle ungiven)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, obsolete) To yield; relax; slacken; give way; loosen.
(transitive) To take back something that had been given.
examples: "Impossible," Vail said. "She's going to work at one of the prestige films at the end of this month. She's already given notice!" "Well apparently she ungave it. [...]"
